channel.title: Hidding the stuff in your cleint folder need help!
channel.description: hey i was wonder how do you hide the folders like sprites and client so other people cannot leech ive seen client folders where all it said were run and i was wondering if someone could please help me.. if so i will rep you alot

item.title: Hidding the stuff in your cleint folder need help!
item.dc:creator: @ownagesbot ownagesbot
item.description:
@ownagesbot wrote:

Firstly obfuscate them with proguard or something. Next, you have a couple of options, something such as Jar2Exe will turn them into an executable file, its much harder to get the files from this exe (although anybody that knows anything here can do it). Or you can just have an executable jar. The first is probably the best as it stops noobs ripping your code and writing bots etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Hidding the stuff in your cleint folder need help!

item.title: Hidding the stuff in your cleint folder need help!
item.dc:creator: @xxx_code_this xxx code this
item.description:
@xxx_code_this wrote:

select them all the files u want to hide right click properties than you see read only click hidden after that go tools in folder… folder option click tab view and u see show hidden files and click do not show hidden files press okay done

Read full topic

item.title: Hidding the stuff in your cleint folder need help!
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

[quote=“manuboyharry, post:8, topic:293088”]Highlight the folders/files you want to hide. Right-click on them and click properties. Then check the box that says ‘Hidden’. Then click apply. This will only part-work, because most people have the option in to ‘Show Hidden Files’, although it is not a windows default. This will help a bit.
Also i dont know if you are releasing something and you want to stop people from leeching, but if you are you can do this:
Once you have compiled, you could delete the .java files. (Not the .class ones!!!) And then no-one can edit them, unless they have a de-compiler, which not many people do.
Hope this helped[/quote]
THIS IS FUCKING RSC not RS2!!
Can’t you all read.

Read full topic
item.source: Hidding the stuff in your cleint folder need help!

item.title: Hidding the stuff in your cleint folder need help!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Highlight the folders/files you want to hide. Right-click on them and click properties. Then check the box that says ‘Hidden’. Then click apply. This will only part-work, because most people have the option in to ‘Show Hidden Files’, although it is not a windows default. This will help a bit.
Also i dont know if you are releasing something and you want to stop people from leeching, but if you are you can do this:
Once you have compiled, you could delete the .java files. (Not the .class ones!!!) And then no-one can edit them, unless they have a de-compiler, which not many people do.
Hope this helped

Read full topic
item.source: Hidding the stuff in your cleint folder need help!

item.title: Hidding the stuff in your cleint folder need help!
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

You can try and come up with an encryption/decryption method for the data files so they wont be able to be used by anyone else, but in general hiding them wont stop anyone.

Read full topic
